docs.snippet: The proposed visit of Dr. Lauro Muller, Brazilian Minister of Foreign Affairs to Uruguay and Argentina, announced in dispatches from Rio Janeiro in this morning's papers, evidently marks the inception of a movement that has been long discussed among...
docs.lead_paragraph: The proposed visit of Dr. Lauro Muller, Brazilian Minister of Foreign Affairs to Uruguay and Argentina, announced in dispatches from Rio Janeiro in this morning's papers, evidently marks the inception of a movement that has been long discussed among the South American republics, a movement fraught with the gravest consequences to the whole American continent and to no part of it more seriously than these United States.

headline.main: LATIN AMERICA'S SECRET FEAR OF US.; A Movement Almost Unknown to This Country May Now Be Coming to a Head Under the Leadership of a Brazilian Statesman.

docs.snippet: Charles Bright, a promoter, whose home is in Uruguay, was arrested yesterday and locked up in Ludlow Street Jail for failing to pay a fine of $250 for contempt of court.
docs.lead_paragraph: Charles Bright, a promoter, whose home is in Uruguay, was arrested yesterday and locked up in Ludlow Street Jail for failing to pay a fine of $250 for contempt of court.
docs.abstract: De Rustafjaell, Robert, antique jewelry store robbed

headline.main: PROMOTER IS IN CONTEMPT.; Charles Bright of Uruguay Locked Up for Failing to Pay Fine.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 30. -- While they are still without definite information on the subject, officials and others interested in Latin-American affairs have no reason to modify the view prevailing here that the visit of Dr. Lauro Muller, Brazilian...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 30. -- While they are still without definite information on the subject, officials and others interested in Latin-American affairs have no reason to modify the view prevailing here that the visit of Dr. Lauro Muller, Brazilian Minister for Foreign Affairs, to the capitals of Argentina, Chile, and Uruguay, is not intended to bring about the formation of a South American alliance directed against the United States.

headline.main: DENY A B C UNION IS AIMED AT US; Washington Authorities See No Danger in the Mission of Brazilian Envoy. SAY CONTRARY SEEMS TRUE Many Evidences That South American Powers Desire Closer Relations with This Country.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: I was painfully surprised to read in your edition of last Friday a letter purported to be from a retired Journalist, in which is clearly revealed a misguided though perhaps bona fide intention of warning this country against the socalled A B C...

headline.main: MR. MULLER'S VISIT.; Denial That Its Purport Is Hostile to the United States.

docs.snippet: A foundation upon which a United Americans may be built was the subject of Frank A. Vanderlip's address at the luncheon meeting of the Members' Council of the Merchants' Association at the Hotel Astor yesterday. A welcome was extended to the Central...
docs.lead_paragraph: A foundation upon which a United Americans may be built was the subject of Frank A. Vanderlip's address at the luncheon meeting of the Members' Council of the Merchants' Association at the Hotel Astor yesterday. A welcome was extended to the Central and South American delegates to the Foreign Trade Financial Congress soon to be held in Washington.
docs.abstract: pictures a united Americas at reception of Merchants' Assoc. to Pan-Amer. delegates

headline.main: VANDERLIP PICTURES A UNITED AMERICAS; Tells Latin American Delegates of the Ideals of the United States AT MERCHANTS' LUNCHEON Acting Mayor McAneny Welcomes Representatives from the South -- Argentina Responds.

docs.snippet: IT was Nicholas Murray Butler, President of Columbia University, who first predicted that in the course of this European war the United States of America would develop a world importance hitherto unknown to it.

headline.main: NEUTRALITY SHOWS WORLD POWER; There May Be Times When Only Mighty Strength Will Enable a Bystander to Remain Out of a Quarrel, Says President Butler.
